intro: Cordia juglandifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian chestnut or Brazil nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces small, woody fruits that contain up to 15 seeds, which are the edible Brazil nuts. Its botanical features include a thick, rugged bark and a tendency to form a dense canopy, making it an important component of tropical rainforest ecosystems.
